isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 6 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS SPICER PSO140-61 - REASSEMBLE - CASE AND GEARS

step1.para: Reassembly of the transmission begins by placing the lower reverse idler gear and the shaft into the case ( Figure 71).

figure.caption: Figure 71. Place Lower Reverse Idler Gear and Shaft into Case

step1.para: Install the left side countershaft first, then the right side ( Figure 72). Alignment blocks ZTSE-4328 are recommended.

figure.caption: Figure 72. Install Left Side Countershaft First, Then Right Side

step1.para: Set the upper reverse idler gear into the case ( Figure 73). However, do not install the shaft at this time.

figure.caption: Figure 73. Set Upper Reverse Idler Gear into Case

step1.para: Lower the mainshaft assembly into the case ( Figure 74).

figure.caption: Figure 74. Lower Mainshaft Assembly into Case

step1.para: Cut and remove the lockwire ( Figure 75). Slide the reverse gear rearward and install the first gear bore snap ring.

figure.caption: Figure 75. Cut and Remove Lockwire

step1.para: Place both the internally and the externally splined thrust washers into the bore and secure these washers with the remaining gear bore snap ring ( Figure 76).

figure.caption: Figure 76. Place Thrust Washers into Bore

step1.para: Install the internally splined thrust washer and secure it with the mainshaft snap ring ( Figure 77).

figure.caption: Figure 77. Install Thrust Washer and Secure with Mainshaft Snap Ring

step1.para: Slide the output bearing onto the shaft and use a suitable driver to install the bearing ( Figure 78).

figure.caption: Figure 78. Slide Output Bearing onto Shaft

step1.para: Align the countershaft timing marks toward the center of the case ( Figure 79).

figure.caption: Figure 79. Align Countershaft Timing Marks

step1.para: Install the 5th-6th clutch collar ( Figure 80).

figure.caption: Figure 80. Install 5th-6th Clutch Collar

step1.para: Place the input subassembly into the case, then install the input bearing cap and secure with bolts ( Figure 81).

figure.caption: Figure 81. Place Input Subassembly into Case

step1.para: With the aid of a lift hook, set the countershaft in time ( Figure 82) by matching the timing marks ( Figure 83).

figure.caption: Figure 82. Set Countershaft in Time
Figure 83. Match Timing Marks

step1.para: Install both the front and rear bearings ( Figure 84).

figure.caption: Figure 84. Install Front and Rear Bearings

step1.para: Repeat this procedure for the remaining countershaft ( Figure 85).

figure.caption: Figure 85. Repeat Procedure For Remaining Countershaft

step1.para: The input shaft may now be rotated to check for correct timing ( Figure 86). If the shaft turns freely, the unit is in time. If it locks up, check the timing marks for proper alignment.

figure.caption: Figure 86. Check For Correct Timing

step1.para: Install the upper reverse idler shaft with lockball ( Figure 87). It is necessary to lift up on the mainshaft reverse gear to obtain proper alignment.

figure.caption: Figure 87. Install Upper Reverse Idler Shaft with Lockball

step1.para: Secure the countershaft rear bearing caps with bolts ( Figure 88). Tighten to 34 to 41 ft-lbs. (46 to 56 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 88. Secure Countershaft Rear Bearing Caps with Bolts

step1.para: Place the output bearing cap on the case and secure with bolts ( Figure 89). Tighten to 60 to 80 ft-lbs. (81 to 109 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 89. Place Output Bearing Cap on Case and Secure With Bolts

step1.para: Assemble the clutch housing to the case ( Figure 90). Tighten the bolts to 150 to 180 ft-lbs. (203 to 244 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 90. Assemble Clutch Housing to Case

step1.para: Shift all the clutch collars into the neutral position ( Figure 91).

figure.caption: Figure 91. Shift Clutch Collars into Neutral Position

step1.para: Place the shifter housing in its proper location and secure with bolts ( Figure 92). Tighten to 34 to 41 ft-lbs. (46 to 56 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 92. Place Shifter Housing in Proper Location and Secure With Bolts
